column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r2552552416\r\r1\r2552452314\r\r2\r225245235\r\r3\r2452114255\r\r4\r2552352314\r\r5\r2214265245\r\rOther**\r\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement555\r\rA constructive evaluation process promotes quality instruction and is a fundamental element in a sound educational program. Evaluations and formal\robservationsare designedtoencouragecommongoalsand tocomplywiththe state’sevaluationcriteriaanddistrict policies.Temporaryand\rprobationary teachers are evaluated annually and tenured teachers are evaluated every other year.\r\rEvaluations are conducted by site administrators
column3: who have been trained and certified for competency to perform teacher evaluations. Evaluation criteria\rincludes the following:\r•Engaging and Supporting all Students in Learning\r•Understanding and Organizing Subject Matter for Student Learning\r•Assessing Student Learning\r•Creating and Maintaining Effective Environments for Student Learning\r•Planning Instruction and Designing Learning Experiences for all Students\r•Developing as a Professional Educator\rStaff members build teaching skills and concepts through participation in conferences and workshops throughout the year. Staff members collaborate\rdaily and the district has built in time on Wednesdays for further Professional Development. During this time
column4: teachers are offered a broad-based variety\rof professional growth opportunities in curriculum
column6: technology and methodologies. Our teachers continue to attend District training\rthat focus on research based best instructional practices and continue to review the practices with the support of our school site administrators and\rInstructional Coach. We have also partnered with Tulare County Office of Education and the English Learner Group for additional professional learning.\r\rFor additional support in their profession
column7: teachers may enlist the services of the district’s Beginning Teacher Induction Program (TIP) facilitator and/or\rthe IMPACT program.\r\r\rState Average for\rFY 2017-18 Teacher and Administrative SalariesDistrict\rPercent of District BudgetDistricts In Same\rCategory DistrictAmount State Average for\rCategory\rDistricts In Same\rAmount\rTeacher Salaries32%35%\rCategory\rAdministrative Salaries4%5%\rBeginning Teacher Salary$52
